intro: Truellum nepalense, commonly known as the Nepal thistle, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayan region. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are usually hairy and serrated, while the flowers are small and yellowish. Truellum nepalense plays a role in local ecosystems by providing food for pollinators and contributing to soil stability.
